content:
I'm glad you're excited! However, I should clarify that I'm an AI, I don't have personal experiences, preferences, or taste buds. I'm here to provide information and assist with your queries.

But I'm happy to help you explore Indian cuisine and suggest some popular dishes you might want to learn in your hands-on class! Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan Bread are excellent choices, and you might also consider learning to make other classics like:

1. Palak Paneer (spinach and paneer cheese curry)
2. Chana Masala (chickpea curry)
3. Samosas (crunchy fried or baked pastries filled with spiced potatoes and peas)
4. Biryani (mixed rice dish with aromatic spices, basmati rice, and marinated meat or vegetables)
5. Gulab Jamun (deep-fried dumplings soaked in sweet syrup)

These dishes are not only delicious but also relatively accessible for beginners. Be sure to discuss your interests and preferences with your instructor, and they can help you create a customized learning experience.

Remember to enjoy the process, ask questions, and don't hesitate to try new ingredients and techniques. You'll be cooking up a storm in no time!
